channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN

item.title: Report X-2024061409
item.description:
Report X-2024061409

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was discovered during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained ten glass bottles that were packed in plastic bags with bubble wrap and Styrofoam packing peanuts for dunnage. Two of the glass bottles were broken spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024061410
item.description:
Report X-2024061410

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was presented to the MEMH spill office with an odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered a release of the contents. The box contained 1 small oblong box, 2 plastic bottles, and 1 metal can. Vermiculite was used for dunnage. The box, bottles, and can were enclosed in a single clear Ziploc bag. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024061411
item.description:
Report X-2024061411

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of release was found during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans packaged in plastic bags and had packing paper for dunnage. On of the can was dented causing the lid to open up and spill the contents. All items were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Description: Spill. Hazmat shipped fully regulated. Leaking fiberboard box. One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles of Total Solutions Vanquish lost 0.4 gal of fluid from denting and loose cap closure due to excess weight on package. No internal partitions.

item.title: Report X-2024061103
item.description:
Report X-2024061103

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-09
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 9th a package was found during the PM sort that was leaking. The package was damaged and it contained UN2924, FLAMMABLE LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S., 3(8), III. The damaged packages were placed into a steel salvage drum and are awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024060530
item.description:
Report E-2024060530

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-21
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NNA experienced a release from a 220-gallon metal tote. The tote was shipped as empty with residual material in it. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 1’ x 6” area of the concrete dock due to a loose valve. The contractors tightened the valve which was re-secured for shipment on. The impacted cardboard and rags were collected into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024060506
item.description:
Report E-2024060506

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 14, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN3378 was torn while loading and released approximately fifteen (15) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the UN3264-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly vented drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060514
item.description:
Report E-2024060514

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-NKX contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 5 gallons of WWM Industrial Paint Remover from one 5gal poly pail onto the dock and trailer floors. The pail was punctured by a forklift at NKX. ERTS will dispatch a contractor to assist with the spill as the material is a regulated corrosive. The terminal has deployed absorbents to the spilled material to prevent further migration.

Report X-2024060509

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-21T15:17:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill. Hazmat shipped fully regulated. 1oz lost from two of four 2.5L plastic bottles of Diversey Glance HC (sku 905779) due to loose cap closures. PLEASE NOTE: Four bottles were placed 2x2 in two UNPOP Y rated fiberboard boxes bundled together with tape; this package may have been erroneously processed with a 96 by origin station, which is why Unprocessed was selected. OVH scan at NASH.
